analyzed: 一時薄伽梵，成就殊勝一切如來金剛加持三麼耶智，已得一切如來灌頂寶冠，為三界主，已證一切如來一切智智，瑜伽自在，能作一切如來一切印平等種種事業，於無盡無餘一切眾生界，一切意願作業皆悉圓滿，常恒三世一切時，身語意業金剛大毘盧遮那如來。

translated: If one is able to uphold it, read and recite it daily, contemplate its meaning, then in this very life one will realize the vajra samādhi of the equality of all dharmas, attain mastery over all dharmas, experience immeasurable delight and joy, and through the sixteen great bodhisattva births, attain the position of the Tathāgata and Vajrapāṇi.

original: 金剛手！

analyzed: 若有聞此四出生法，讀誦受持，設使現行無量重罪，必能超越一切惡趣，乃至當坐菩提道場，速能剋證無上正覺。
translated: If there are those who hear this four-part method of arising, recite and uphold it, even if they presently engage in immeasurable grave offenses, they will surely transcend all evil destinies, and will even sit at the site of enlightenment, quickly attaining the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 」時薄伽梵如是說已，欲重顯明此義故，熈怡微笑，持智拳印，說一切法自性平等心：

translated: Aghora At that time, Śākyamuni Tathāgata, who tames the unruly, again spoke the supreme principle of the equality of all dharmas and the arising of prajñā.

translated: Because delusion is of the nature of non-discursiveness, all dharmas are of the nature of non-discursiveness;

analyzed: 一切法無戲論性故，應知般若波羅蜜多無戲論性。
translated: Because all dharmas are of the nature of non-discursiveness, one should know that prajñā-pāramitā is of the nature of non-discursiveness.

original: 金剛手！
analyzed: 金剛手！
translated: Vajrapāṇi!

translated: If there are those who hear this principle, uphold it, recite it, even if they harm all beings in the three realms, they will not fall into evil destinies, because of their taming, they will quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 」時金剛手大菩薩，欲重顯明此義故，持降三世印，以蓮花面微笑而怒顰眉猛視，利牙出現，住降伏立相，說此金剛吽迦𡆗心：
